benchmark_details.name: MSCoRe (Multi-Stage Collaborative Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: MSCoRe is a novel benchmark designed to assess the multi-stage collaborative reasoning capabilities of LLM agents across four industrial sectors: automotive, pharmaceutical, electronics, and energy. It comprises 126,696 domain-specific question-answer pairs that evaluate reasoning across interconnected stages of workflows.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and improve multi-stage reasoning in LLM agents.

data.source: Generated using a systematic pipeline involving dynamic sampling, iterative question-answer generation, and multi-level quality assessment.
data.annotation: Automated generation with multi-level quality assurance

methodology.calculation: Scores calculated across predefined difficulty levels (easy, medium, hard) based on the complexity of reasoning stages.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ROUGE-L scores indicate better multi-stage reasoning performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance of various state-of-the-art models, including commercial models like GPT-4o.
methodology.validation: Utilized a Turing test with expert evaluation on generated data to validate quality.
